title: How to Have an All Night Gaming Session

steps.headline: Gather food for your gaming session 1-2 days in advance.
steps.description: Plan on how you will get the food and wait for the right time to sneak it into your room. Wash some fresh fruits and vegetables and put them into small plastic bags in the fridge. You will be able to sneak these into your room a few hours before you begin.

steps.headline: Charge your system.
steps.description: There's no point in gaming without games, is there?

steps.headline: Create a comfortable area to sit.
steps.description: If you need an extra pillow, be sure to gather that ahead of time.

steps.headline: Figure out a way to access a computer at night without waking up your parents.
steps.description: Computer games are important, as well as console games.

steps.headline: If you do have a computer available for the night, equip it with a webcam and microphone.
steps.description: Obviously, do not use the mic if you could wake up your parents. The webcam is easy to use without getting caught. If you go onto www.tinychat.com with some friends and broadcast yourself playing games, you may get some helpful advice.

steps.headline: Download the programs Steam and XFire onto your computer (if applicable).
steps.description: These will make gaming at night quite a bit more entertaining.

steps.headline: Buy or print out guides to video games you want to play during this gaming session.
steps.description: If you are not worried about printing at midnight, go ahead and bookmark the pages.

steps.headline: Go into your bed at the normal bedtime you have.
steps.description: Make sure your parents are asleep first, then you can play on your handheld device.

steps.headline: Once your parents have fallen asleep, get onto your computer.
steps.description: If you do not have one that can be accessed at the moment, skip to the next step. Otherwise, pick one of your favorite games and play it for an hour.

steps.headline: After the computer gaming has gone on for an hour or so, take a little break.
steps.description: Grab a healthy and a salty snack. While eating, move to your console games and get comfortable. Bring your cell phone and music player.

steps.headline: Once you get bored, pick a game you have never played or have not played in a long time.
steps.description: This will make you more awake and possibly be a bit nostalgic.

steps.headline: Repeat these steps throughout the night.
steps.description: To sum the night up, don't spend all your time in one place. Multiple activities are what keep you awake.
